name: src/Gradient.js
src/Line.js
Line
description:
Create a line object represnting a set of two points in 2D space.

Line objects can be constructed by passing in either 4 numbers (startX, startY, endX, endY) - or
two {@link Point} objects representing `start` and `end` respectively

name: constructor
description: Construct a Line using 4 {@link number}s

params.name: startX
params.description: Starting position on the X axis

params.name: startY
params.description: Starting position on the Y axis

params.name: endX
params.description: Ending position on the X axis

params.name: endY
params.description: Ending position on the Y acis

name: getLength
description: Get the line length

name: Context
description:
Used for drawing rectangles, text, images and other objects onto the canvas element. It provides the 2D rendering context for a drawing surface.

It has the same API as [CanvasRenderingContext2D](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D) from the HTML5 canvas spec

name: constructor
description: Creates a new pure image Context

params.name: bitmap
params.description: An instance of the {@link Bitmap} class

name: bitmap
description: An instance of the {@link Bitmap} class. Used for direct pixel manipulation(for example setting pixel colours)

name: _fillColor
description: A 32-bit unsigned integer (uint32) number representing the fill color of the 2D drawing context

name: fillStyle
description: The color or style to use inside shapes. The default is #000 (black).

name: strokeStyle
description: The color or style to use for the lines around shapes. The default is #000 (black).

name: lineWidth
description: The thickness of lines in space units. When getting, it returns the current value (1.0 by default). When setting, zero, negative, `Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored; otherwise the current value is set to the new value.

name: globalAlpha
description: The alpha value that is applied to shapes and images before they are drawn onto the canvas. The value is in the range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

name: font
description: The current text style being used when drawing text. This string uses the same syntax as the CSS font specifier

properties.name: size
properties.description: The an integer representing the font size to use

name: save
description: Saves the entire state of the canvas by pushing the current state onto a stack

name: translate
description: Adds a translation transformation by moving the canvas and its origin `x` horizontally and `y` vertically on the grid

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

name: rotate
description: Add a rotation to the transformation matrix. The angle argument represents a clockwise rotation angle and is expressed in adians

params.name: angle
params.description: Degrees of rotation (in radians)

name: scale
description: Adds a scaling transformation to the canvas units by `x` horizontally and by `y` vertically

params.name: sx
params.description: Scale X amount

params.name: sy
params.description: Scale Y amount

name: restore
description: Restores the most recently saved canvas state by popping the top entry in the drawing state stack. If there is no saved state, this method does nothing.

name: fillRect
description: Draws a filled rectangle whose starting point is at the coordinates `(x, y)` with the specified width and height and whose style is determined by the fillStyle attribute.

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

params.name: w
params.description: Width

params.name: h
params.description: Height

name: clearRect
description: Sets all pixels in the rectangle defined by starting point `(x, y)` and size `(width, height)` to transparent black, erasing any previously drawn content.

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

params.name: w
params.description: Width

params.name: h
params.description: Height

name: strokeRect
description: Paints a rectangle which has a starting point at `(x, y)` and has a `w` width and an `h` height onto the canvas, using the current stroke style.

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

params.name: w
params.description: Width

params.name: h
params.description: Height

name: fillPixel
description: Set the background colour of a single pixel denoted by the `x` and `y` co-ordinates

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the pixel

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the pixel

name: strokePixel
description: Paints a pixel which has an x axis position of `x` and a y axis position of `y`

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the pixel to stroke

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the pixel to stroke

name: fillPixelWithColor
description: Fill Pixel With Color

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the pixel to fill

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the pixel to fill

name: composite
description: Composite

params.name: i
params.description: Unused

params.name: j
params.description: Unused

description: Calculate RGBA Stroke

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: w

params.name: h
params.description: Height

name: putImageData
description: *Put Image Data

params.name: id
params.description: Image ID

params.name: x
params.description: X position

params.name: y
params.description: Y position

name: drawImage
description: Provides different ways to draw an image onto the canvas.

params.name: bitmap
params.description: An instance of the {@link Bitmap} class to use for drawing

params.name: sx
params.description: The X coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context.

params.name: sy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context.

params.name: sw
params.description: The width of the sub-rectangle of the source {@link Bitmap} to draw into the destination context. If not specified, the entire rectangle from the coordinates specified by `sx` and `sy` to the bottom-right corner of the image is used.

params.name: sh
params.description: The height of the sub-rectangle of the source {@link Bitmap} to draw into the destination context.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source {@link Bitmap}

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source {@link Bitmap}

params.name: dw
params.description: The width to draw the {@link Bitmap} in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in width when drawn

params.name: dh
params.description: The height to draw the {@link Bitmap} in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in height when drawn

name: beginPath
description: Starts a new path by emptying the list of sub-paths. Call this method when you want to create a new path.

name: moveTo
description: Moves the starting point of a new sub-path to the (x, y) coordinates.

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the point.

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the point.

name: _moveTo
description: Moves the starting point of a new sub-path to the (x, y) coordinates.

params.name: pt
params.description: A `point` object representing a set of co-ordinates to move the "pen" to.

name: pathstart
description: Set the starting co-ordinates for the path starting point

name: lineTo
description: Connects the last point in the sub-path to the x, y coordinates with a straight line (but does not actually draw it).

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end of the line.

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end of the line.

name: _lineTo
description: Connects the last point in the sub-path to the x, y coordinates with a straight line (but does not actually draw it).

params.name: pt
params.description: A point object to draw a line to from the current set of co-ordinates

name: quadraticCurveTo
description: Adds a quadratic Bzier curve to the path. It requires two points. The first point is a control point and the second one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed using moveTo() before creating the quadratic Bzier curve.

params.name: cp1x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the control point.

params.name: cp1y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the control point.

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end point.

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end point.

name: bezierCurveTo
description: Adds a cubic Bzier curve to the path. It requires three points. The first two points are control points and the third one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed using moveTo() before creating the Bzier curve.

params.name: cp1x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the first control point.

params.name: cp1y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for first control point.

params.name: cp2x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: cp2y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end point.

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end point.

name: _bezierCurveTo
description: Bezier Curve To

params.name: cp1
params.description: Curve point 1

params.name: cp2
params.description: Curve point 2

name: arc
description: Adds an arc to the path which is centered at (x, y) position with radius r starting at startAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the arc's center

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the arc's center

params.name: rad
params.description: The arc's radius

params.name: start
params.description: The angle at which the arc starts, measured clockwise from the positive x axis and expressed in radians

params.name: end
params.description: The angle at which the arc ends, measured clockwise from the positive x axis and expressed in radians

params.name: anticlockwise
params.description: A boolean which, if true, causes the arc to be drawn anticlockwise between the two angles.

name: arcTo
description: Arc To

name: rect
description: Rect

name: ellipse
description: Ellipse

name: clip
description: Turns the path currently being built into the current clipping path.

name: measureText
description: Measure Text

name: closePath
description: Causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path. It tries to add a straight line (but does not actually draw it) from the current point to the start. If the shape has already been closed or has only one point, this function does nothing.

name: stroke
description: Strokes the current or given path with the current stroke style

name: drawLine
description: Draw a line using the correct anti-aliased, or non-anti-aliased line drawing function based on the value of {@link imageSmoothingEnabled}
examples:
//All of the following are valid:
ctx.drawLine({start: {x: 20, y:42}, end: {x: 20, y:90}})
ctx.drawLine(new Line(new Point(20, 42), new Point(20, 90)))
ctx.drawLine(new Line(20, 42, 20, 90))

params.name: line
params.description: A set of co-ordinates representing the start and end of the line. You can also pass a plain js object if you wish

name: drawLine_noaa
description: Draw a line without anti-aliasing using Bresenham's algorithm
examples:
//All of the following are valid:
ctx.drawLine({start: {x: 20, y:42}, end: {x: 20, y:90}})
ctx.drawLine(new Line(new Point(20, 42), new Point(20, 90)))
ctx.drawLine(new Line(20, 42, 20, 90))

params.name: line
params.description: A set of co-ordinates representing the start and end of the line. You can also pass a plain js object if you wish

name: drawLine_aa
description:
Draw Line Anti-aliased

Draw anti-aliased line using Bresenham's algorithm
examples:
//All of the following are valid:
ctx.drawLine({start: {x: 20, y:42}, end: {x: 20, y:90}})
ctx.drawLine(new Line(new Point(20, 42), new Point(20, 90)))
ctx.drawLine(new Line(20, 42, 20, 90))

params.name: line
params.description: A set of co-ordinates representing the start and end of the line. You can also pass a plain js object if you wish

name: fill
description: Fills the current or given path with the current fill style. Uses {@link fill_aa} and {@link fill_noaa} depending on the the value of {@link imageSmoothingEnabled}

name: fill_aa
description: Fill Anti-aliased

name: fill_noaa
description: Fill No Anti-aliased

name: pixelInsideClip
description:
Pixel Inside Clip

Even/odd rule. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Point_in_polygon
technically this is not correct as the default algorithm for
html canvas is supposed to be the non-zero winding rule instead

name: fillText
description: Draws a text string at the specified coordinates, filling the string's characters with the current foreground color

params.name: text
params.description: A string specifying the text string to render into the context. The text is rendered using the settings specified by {@link font}.

params.name: x
params.description: The x -coordinate of the point at which to begin drawing the text, in pixels.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the point at which to begin drawing the text, in pixels.

name: strokeText
description: Draws the outlines of the characters of a specified text string at the given (x, y) position.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to draw using the current {@link font} values.

params.name: x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the text starting point.

params.name: y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the text starting point.

name: colorStringToUint32
description:
Color String To Unint32

Convert a color string to Uint32 notation

params.name: str
params.description: The color string to convert
